comment.author: 47453095@N03
comment._content: Nice to see such an old picture !!!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I think the "big event" was not just the premiere of 'The Patriot' but the opening of the wonderful State Theatre in Market Street, Friday 7 June 1929 (not 1928). See newspaper report - SMH 8/6/1929 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16567130 Which makes the image much more interesting and historic.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: 'The Patriot' (1928) - www.imdb.com/title/tt0019257/ The trailer is on YouTube - www.youtube.com/watch?v=QoFeHPvOOSo The State Theatre Sydney - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_Theatre_(Sydney)

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Well spotted. And thanks for the links. A tantalising glimpse of the lost film.

comment.author: 8481360@N04
comment._content: The photo also shows how the State Theatre originaly had statues on its facade just above the neon sign.
